common_issues.title: Pieces OS: High CPU Usage and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, high CPU usage, and unresponsiveness, particularly with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled. Issues affect various apps like Slack, Discord, and browsers. Solutions include LTM patches (v11.2.2, v11.2.3), restarting LTM, and Pieces Desktop updates (v3.0.2, v3.1.0). Some users found moving Pieces data to a ReFS drive helpful.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## GitHub Issue Summary: High CPU Usage on Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* High CPU usage on Pieces OS with LTM-2 enabled.
* Multiple users experiencing the issue on different hardware and operating systems.
* Discord and Microsoft Edge particularly affected.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM-2 causing increased CPU usage.
* WebView2 components might be contributing to the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A hotfix patch was released for v11.2.2.
* Further patches were released for v11.2.3.
* Restarting LTM-2 temporarily helped for some users.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* v11.2.3 appears to have resolved the issue for most users.
* Ongoing investigation into why some users still experience spikes.

**Additional Notes:**

* User KnifMelti found that moving the com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folder to a ReFS drive and creating symbolic links improved performance.
* Turning LTM-2 off and on again can temporarily alleviate the issue for some users.

Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

    * Long Term Memory slowing down PC
    * PiecesOS failing to launch

**Problems Identified:**

* Several technical issues impacting user experience and causing frustration.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Team offered suggestions for existing related issues.
* @mark-at-pieces reached out offering debugging assistance and a follow-up call.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unresolved. @bpluly did not respond to the offer of assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred in March 2025. 
* Information beyond November 2023 isn't available, so the ultimate resolution remains unknown.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Copilot Lag and Performance Issues

**Key points raised:**

* Copilot experiences significant slowdown after using the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" function. 
* The lag occurs after sending a message, clicking hard-reset, and sending another message. 
* The copilot then gets stuck in an infinite loading state. 
* High CPU usage and unresponsive copilot even after updating and performing hard resets.

**Problems identified:**

* Bug causing values to not reset correctly, preventing proper websocket re-initialization. 
* Performance degradation persists despite updates. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Fix for bug in "Hard-Reset Active Runtime"**: Released as a patch during the same week as issue reporting.
* **Improved performance with Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2**: Released on Jul 19, 2024.
* **Significant performance improvements in Desktop app version 3.1.0**: Released on Aug 15, 2024.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The initial bug preventing proper runtime resets was addressed in a patch released in July 2024. 
* Further performance improvements were implemented in later versions of both the Pieces OS and the Desktop App.
* While some users continue to experience lag (e.g., harshilsodani, navdeepdev459), it's unclear whether this is due to residual performance issues or other system-specific factors. 
* The team is requesting additional information from affected users to investigate remaining performance concerns.

related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Copilot not responding properly to user questions.

**Key points:**

* User encountered the bug after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses. No files were loaded into the context.
* Issue was not reproducible on the support team's end.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User switched their LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.
* The support team indicated the issue would be fixed in the next release.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue is believed to be fixed with the 11.2.3 update.
* User is advised to reach out again if the issue persists after the update.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of Conversation on GitHub Issue #652

**Key points raised:**

* Several users experienced PiecesOS entering "basic mode" on M3 MacBooks.
* This caused errors like missing Workstream Activity and LTM updates.
* The issue was not reproducible consistently.
* An "Unknown Origin" element appeared in some users' telemetry browser.

**Problems identified:**

* Basic mode activated unexpectedly on M3 MacBooks.
* Workstream Activity disappeared in the Desktop App.
* LTM updates were missing.
* Unknown application appeared in some users' telemetry browser.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested restarting PiecesOS as a temporary fix.
* They confirmed a fix would be included in the next PiecesOS version.
* Mack-at-pieces acknowledged the bug causing basic mode and offered additional troubleshooting.
* User interface issues in minimized window were identified and feedback given.
* "Unknown Origin" element needed further investigation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Bug causing basic mode on M3 MacBooks is being addressed.
* Workstream Activity issues were identified as UI-related and potential improvements discussed.
* "Unknown Origin" element requires further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and tracked internally.
* Several users contributed to the conversation with information and screenshots.
* Mark-at-pieces and Mack-at-pieces offered support and information regarding the issues.
* The conversation is ongoing and a final resolution is expected in the next PiecesOS version.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* kwburgess created an issue reporting problems activating LTM.
* pieces-support-bot flagged the issue and provided suggestions based on previous similar issues.
* mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a permissioning problem and provided detailed instructions on resolving it.
* PiecesOS reported all necessary permissions enabled.

**Problems identified:**

* kwburgess unable to activate LTM due to permissioning issues.
* PiecesOS reported inaccurate information about enabled permissions.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces suggested checking necessary permissions for Screen&System Recording and Accessibility.
* kwburgess confirmed and resolved the permissioning issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Problem solved. kwburgess successfully activated LTM after fixing the permissions.

* User (@MoyinShabi) experiences issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* No notifications regarding a recent update or health check were received.
* The user shared log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder for troubleshooting.
* Mack (@mack-at-pieces) identified a database issue and a potential bug fix.

### Identified Problems:

* Database issue within the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* Potential bug preventing the app from booting.

* Suggested a video call for further troubleshooting.

* A potential cause related to the GetIt package was identified in the logs.
* Troubleshooting continues.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS boot-up process is slow.
* Desktop application fails to run due to core dependency issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support Bot flagged the issue and assigned it to the proper team.
* Mark from the Pieces team confirmed the issue and stated it will be resolved in the next Desktop application release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue acknowledged by Pieces team and fix is planned for the next Desktop application release.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation was initiated by a bot and followed up by a human support representative.
* Resources (related issues, documentation, and YouTube channel) were provided for further assistance.

Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
